title: Air Canada to resume flights after pay deal struck with union
byline: Flight crew at Air Canada have ended a dispute with the airline which had grounded flights and stranded thousands of passengers since Saturday.

title: Court orders report on unauthorised excavation in Anuradhapura involving wife of DIG
byline: The Anuradhapura Magistrate’s Court has ordered that an urgent report be submitted regarding alleged unauthorised excavations carried out in the Timbirigaskadawala area of Sravastipura, Anuradhapura, allegedly in search of treasure.

title: “Suwa Seriya” ambulances to be increased from 272 to 400
byline: A review of the projects implemented under the 2025 budgetary allocations for the Ministry of Health and Mass Media, together with a pre-budget discussion for the year 2026, was held yesterday (19) at the Presidential Secretariat under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Few showers expected in parts of the country today
byline: A few showers can be expected in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in the Kandy, Nuwara Eliya, Galle and Matara districts today, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Sri Lanka Aviation Unit honoured for outstanding service in MINUSCA
byline: The Sri Lanka Aviation Unit in Bria, serving under the United Nations mandate in the Central African Republic, has received high praise and official commendation for the successful execution of a high-risk Casualty Evacuation mission.

title: India, China agree to resume direct flights, boost business links
byline: India and China agreed on Tuesday to resume direct flights and step up trade and investment flows as the neighbours rebuild ties damaged by a deadly border clash in 2020.

title: Over 1,300 driving licenses issued to foreign nationals at BIA
byline: A total of 1,338 driving licenses have been issued to foreign nationals by the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) office established at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake since its opening.

title: Health Ministry temporarily suspends staff leave, Union claims decision unlawful
byline: The Ministry of Health states that due to a high volume of staff members taking leave of absence, it has become increasingly difficult to sustain the continuous operation of essential services within the ministry.

title: White House launches official TikTok account
byline: The White House launched an official TikTok account on Tuesday, taking advantage of its more than 150 million U.S. users to spread the messages of President Donald Trump.

title: Postal workers continue strike action across the country
byline: The Postal and Telecommunication Officers’ Union has announced that the trade union action initiated by postal workers on Sunday, will continue today as well, affecting postal operations across the country.

title: Ex-Minister Manusha Nanayakkara arrives at Illegal Assets Investigation Division
byline: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara has arrived at the Illegal Assets Investigation Division of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), a short while ago, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Man Killed with blunt weapon in Peliyagoda
byline: An individual has been killed with the use of a blunt weapon in Wedamulla, Peliyagoda, police said.

title: Israel demands release of all Gaza hostages, casting doubt on ceasefire proposal
byline: Israel is demanding the release of all 50 hostages held in Gaza, an Israeli official has said, casting doubt on whether it will accept a new proposal for a 60-day ceasefire that Hamas agreed to on Monday.

title: President directs to implement women’s empowerment programs aimed at eradicating rural poverty
byline: A pre-budget meeting for the Ministry of Women and Child Affairs for the year 2026 was held this morning (20) at the Presidential Secretariat, presided over by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Apple may skip iPhone 18 in 2026 to launch first foldable iPhone
byline: Apple is reportedly unlikely to launch the standard iPhone 18 model next year, with the base version now expected to be released in 2027. This marks a shift in the company’s traditional release cycle.

title: Israel approves plan to conquer Gaza City, call up 60,000 reservists
byline: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz has approved the military’s plan to conquer Gaza City and authorised the call-up of around 60,000 reservists to carry it out, his ministry confirmed on Wednesday.

title: “I want to try and get to heaven”: Trump on solving Russian-Ukraine war
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said Tuesday that a Ukraine peace deal could boost his chances of getting to heaven -- joking that his odds of making it through the pearly gates are currently low.

title: Sri Lanka says anti-doping suspension over ‘procedural delay’
byline: Sri Lanka’s suspension this week from the World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) was due to “procedural challenges” in updating the island’s sports law, the local governing body said Wednesday.

title: Manusha leaves Illegal Assets Investigation Division after recording statement
byline: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara has left the Illegal Assets Investigation Division of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), a short while ago, after providing a statement for nearly 7 hours, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: iPhone 17 Air tipped to beat Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge in thinnest phone race
byline: Apple’s upcoming iPhone 17 Air is rumored to be just 5.44mm thick, which could make it slimmer than Samsung’s Galaxy S25 Edge, according to tech experts.

title: Lanka Salt Company reduces prices
byline: The Lanka Salt Limited has announced a reduction in the prices of its iodized salt products.

title: Over 1,300 bullets found from abandoned well in Jaffna
byline: A total of 1,393 bullets have been recovered from an abandoned well in Kodikamam, Jaffna, police said.

title: Death toll in Nigeria mosque attack rises to 50, dozens abducted
byline: The death toll from an attack by gunmen on a mosque and nearby homes in Nigeria’s northwest Katsina state has risen to at least 50, with around 60 others abducted, local officials and residents said on Wednesday.

title: At least 71 die in bus crash involving Afghans deported from Iran
byline: A passenger bus carrying migrants recently returned from Iran has collided with a truck and a motorcycle in western Afghanistan, killing 71 people.

title: India plans to ban online games played with money, citing addiction risks
byline: India’s government plans to ban online games played with money, a proposed bill showed on Tuesday, in what would be a heavy blow for an industry that has attracted billions of dollars of foreign investment.

title: Strike launched at Gampaha Hospital by allied health professionals
byline: The Joint Council of Professions Supplementary to Medicine has launched an unannounced trade union action at 8:00 a.m. today at the Gampaha District General Hospital.

title: Bribery case filed against ex-Minister Lakshman Yapa to be taken up in September
byline: The Colombo High Court today (20) ordered to call a pre-trial conference in the case filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) against former Minister of Investment Promotion Lakshman Yapa Abeywardena and former Director General of the Board of Investment (BOI) Jayantha Edirisinghe on September 7.

title: Deshabandu Tennakoon’s anticipatory bail application rejected
byline: An anticipatory bail application filed by former Inspector General of Police Deshabandu Tennakoon, seeking an order to prevent his arrest, has been rejected by the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Harry Potter series announces Weasley children castings as filming gets underway
byline: HBO’s forthcoming Harry Potter series has just about rounded out its Weasley family casting.

title: Court issues notice to Rajitha Senaratne to appear on August 29
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (20) issued a notice to former Minister Rajitha Senaratne, who is currently under an arrest warrant, directing him to appear before the court on August 29.

title: Ishan Sanka Mapitigama elected Basnayake Nilame of Sabaragamuwa Maha Saman Devalaya
byline: Ishan Sanka Mapitigama has been elected as the Basnayake Nilame of the Sabaragamuwa Maha Saman Devalaya.

title: Former IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon arrested
byline: Former Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: We want Jaffna Airport to be a success story unlike Mattala: Bimal
byline: The Jaffna International Airport will be gradually upgraded with a business plan, Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Bimal Rathnayaka assured in Parliament today.

title: Sri Lanka’s Foreign Minister lauds Vietnam’s dynamic development
byline: Sri Lankan Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism Vijitha Herath has commended Vietnam’s strong and dynamic development, describing it as a role model for his country.

title: Motorcyclist linked to Borella shooting incident arrested
byline: Police have arrested the motorcyclist involved in the recent shooting incident that targeted five youths at the Sahaspura Sirisara Housing Complex in Borella.

title: Gunman arrested in murder of ex-PS member Shantha Mudunkotuwa
byline: The gunman allegedly involved in the shooting and killing of former Homagama Pradeshiya Sabha member Shantha Mudunkotuwa has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), the Police said.
